name: citizeness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a woman who is a citizen (= a person who is a member of a particular country), especially in France at the time of the Revolution : "Is she a citizeness of France?" "Yes, by birth". He said he would be proud and flattered to help the citizeness.
More examplesFewer examplesWhen he came to the microphone, his voice was trembling. "Citizens and citizenesses of the Soviet Union," he began.He was denounced by the Citizen and Citizeness Defarge.
